cols()

cols(array $cols) : $this

Multiple calls to cols() will append to the list of columns, not overwrite the previous columns.

having()

having(string $cond) : $this

Adds a HAVING condition to the query by AND; if a value is passed as the second param, it will be quoted and replaced into the condition wherever a question-mark appears.

Array values are quoted and comma-separated.

{{code: php // simplest but non-secure $select->having("COUNT(id) = $count");

// secure
$select->having('COUNT(id) = ?', $count);

// equivalent security with named binding
$select->having('COUNT(id) = :count');
$select->bind('count', $count);

}}

Parameters

string $cond

The HAVING condition.

Returns

$this

Tags

None found

orHaving()

orHaving(string $cond) : $this

Adds a HAVING condition to the query by AND; otherwise identical to `having()`.

Parameters

string $cond

The HAVING condition.

Returns

$this

See also
